GANCICLOVIR

Indications and doses

Local treatment of herpes simplex infections,

To the eye

  • For adults
    Apply 5 times a day until healing complete, then apply 3 times a day for a further 7 days.

Prevention of cytomegalovirus disease during immunosuppressive therapy following organ transplantation,

By intravenous infusion

  • For adults
    5 mg/kg every 12 hours for 7–14 days.

Treatment of life-threatening or sight-threatening cytomegalovirus infections in immunocompromised patients only,

By intravenous infusion

  • For adults
    5 mg/kg every 12 hours for 14–21 days, followed by maintenance 6 mg/kg daily on 5 days of the week, alternatively 5 mg/kg daily until adequate recovery of immunity, maintenance only for patients at risk of relapse of retinitis, if retinitis progresses initial induction treatment may be repeated.

Advice when patient is pregnant

With intravenous use

Avoid—teratogenic risk.

Advice regarding renal impairment

With intravenous use

Reduce dose if eGFR less than 70 mL/minute/1.73 m2; consult product literature.

Contra indications

  • Abnormally low haemoglobin count (consult product literature)
  • abnormally low neutrophil count (consult product literature)
  • abnormally low platelet count (consult product literature)

Known side effects

Specific side effects

commonOrVeryCommon: abdominal pain, abnormal thinking, anaemia, anorexia, anxiety, arthralgia, chest pain, confusion, constipation, convulsions, cough, depression, dermatitis, diarrhoea, dizziness, dyspepsia, dysphagia, dyspnoea, ear pain, eye pain, fatigue, flatulence, headache, hepatic dysfunction, infection, injection-site reactions, insomnia, leucopenia, macular oedema, myalgia, nausea, night sweats, pancytopenia, peripheral neuropathy, pruritus, pyrexia, renal impairment, retinal detachment, taste disturbance, thrombocytopenia, vitreous floaters, vomiting, weight loss,

uncommon: alopecia, anaphylactic reactions, arrhythmias, disturbances in hearing and vision, haematuria, hypotension, male infertility, mouth ulcers, pancreatitis, psychosis, tremor,

notKnown: burning sensation, superficial punctate keratitis, tingling,

Directions for administration

With intravenous use

Infuse into vein with adequate flow preferably using plastic cannula.

For intravenous infusion (Cymevene ) give intermittently in Gluclose 5% or Sodium chloride 0.9%. Reconstitute initially in water for injections (500 mg/10 mL then dilute to not more than 10 mg/m with infusion fluid (usually 100 mL); give over 1 hour.

Cautions regarding administration

  • With intravenous use: children (possible risk of long-term carcinogenic or reproductive toxicity)
  • With intravenous use: ensure adequate hydration
  • With intravenous use: history of cytopenia
  • With intravenous use: potential carcinogen
  • With intravenous use: potential teratogen
  • With intravenous use: radiotherapy
  • With intravenous use: vesicant

Advice regarding conception and contraception

With intravenous use

Ensure effective contraception during treatment and barrier contraception for men during and for at least 90 days after treatment.

Monitoring requirements

Patient parameters

With intravenous use

Monitor full blood count closely (severe deterioration may require correction and possibly treatment interruption).

Advice regarding handling and storage

With intravenous use

Caution in handling

Ganciclovir is toxic and personnel should be adequately protected during handling and administration; if solution comes into contact with skin or mucosa, wash off immediately with soap and water.

Advice regarding allergies and cross sensitivities

Contraindicated in patients hypersensitive to valganciclovir, aciclovir, or valaciclovir.

Prepared medicinal forms of GANCICLOVIR

There can be variation in the licensing of different medicines containing the same drug.

Powder for solution for infusion
Eye gel
